ans.reasoning: The method callRealMethod() checks if the method is abstract and throws an exception if it is. This is directly related to the failure, as the test attempts to call a real method on a mock of an abstract class.
The answer() method in CallsRealMethods is responsible for invoking the real method on the mock. If the method is abstract, it will lead to the exception seen in the stack trace.
The cannotCallAbstractRealMethod() method is invoked when an attempt is made to call a real method on an abstract class. This method is directly related to the exception thrown in the test.
The isAbstract() method checks if a method is abstract. While it is not directly causing the failure, it is part of the logic that leads to the exception being thrown.
